pros: Great salary and competitive benefits package. The 401k match is one of the best I've seen.
cons: Work-life balance is non-existent. Expect to work 60+ hours a week regularly.

pros: The people here are amazing and the office vibe is very friendly.
cons: Management is completely disconnected from the reality of our daily tasks.

pros: Flexible remote work options are a lifesaver. I can pick up my kids from school easily.
cons: Promotions are based on favoritism rather than actual performance.

pros: Huge emphasis on learning and development. They paid for my entire certification.
cons: The base pay is slightly below market average for this city.

pros: Free snacks and a great gym in the office.
cons: Open office layout makes it very hard to concentrate on deep work.

pros: Leadership has a clear vision for the future and communicates it well.
cons: We are constantly reorganizing which creates a lot of confusion.

pros: My direct manager is incredibly supportive and always has my back.
cons: Upper management moves too slowly on approving budget for new tools.

pros: The stock options could be worth a lot in the future.
cons: Very high turnover rate. I have a new manager every six months.

pros: Great team culture, everyone helps each other out.
cons: The legacy software we use is slow and frustrating.

pros: Generous PTO policy and they actually let you take it.
cons: Salary adjustments for inflation have been non-existent this year.

pros: I learned a lot in my first year here. Good for fresh graduates.
cons: No clear path for career progression after the senior associate level.

pros: The diversity and inclusion initiatives are actually taken seriously here.
cons: Some middle managers are toxic and micromanage everything.

pros: We work on cutting-edge technology which is great for my resume.
cons: Deadlines are often unrealistic and cause unnecessary stress.

pros: The quarterly bonuses are a nice touch when we hit targets.
cons: Health insurance premiums went up significantly this year.

pros: Casual dress code and a very relaxed atmosphere.
cons: Office politics can get nasty if you aren't in the 'in' crowd.

pros: Strong brand name that looks good on a CV.
cons: Bureaucracy is suffocating. It takes weeks to get simple approvals.

pros: The cafeteria food is healthy and subsidized.
cons: Parking is a nightmare if you don't arrive by 8 AM.

pros: Very transparent communication from the CEO during town halls.
cons: Execution of the strategy at the team level is messy.

pros: My team feels like a second family.
cons: Compensation is not transparent. People in the same role make vastly different amounts.

pros: Good work-life balance, rarely have to work weekends.
cons: Raises are capped at 3% regardless of performance.

pros: Opportunities to travel for international conferences.
cons: Reimbursement process for travel expenses is painfully slow.

pros: The maternity and paternity leave policies are industry-leading.
cons: Returning to work after leave was difficult due to lack of support.

pros: Fast-paced environment where you are never bored.
cons: Burnout is real here. Most people leave after 2 years.

pros: Smart colleagues who challenge you to be better.
cons: The review process is subjective and unfair.

pros: We have the best tools and hardware in the industry.
cons: The open floor plan is noisy and distracting.
In practice, if you take time off, you are looked down upon.

pros: Company matches charitable donations which is cool.
cons: Politics at the director level slows everything down.

pros: Great onboarding process for new hires.
cons: Lack of documentation makes it hard to figure things out later.

pros: I love the innovation days where we can work on pet projects.
cons: Regular project work is often dull and repetitive.

pros: Salary is deposited on time, every time.
cons: No bonuses this year despite record profits.

pros: The CEO really cares about the employees.
cons: Middle management acts like a clay layer stopping information flow.

pros: Fun team outings and happy hours.
cons: Forced socialization can be draining for introverts.

pros: Flexible hours allow me to avoid rush hour traffic.
cons: You are expected to answer emails at 9 PM.

pros: Good training programs for leadership skills.
cons: It is very hard to switch departments internally.

pros: The office location is central and easy to get to.
cons: The building itself is old and the AC barely works in summer.

pros: Clear OKRs and goal setting at the start of the year.
cons: Goals are moved constantly so you never actually hit 100%.

pros: They offer tuition reimbursement for grad school.
cons: You have to stay for 2 years after or pay it back.

pros: Collaborative environment where ideas are welcomed.

pros: The yearly retreat is always a highlight.
cons: Daily grind is boring and uninspired.

pros: Decent pay for an entry-level job.
cons: No room for negotiation on salary.

pros: Excellent health benefits and dental plan.

pros: Supportive HR team that listens to concerns.

pros: We are market leaders so job security feels high.

pros: Great mentorship program if you can find a mentor.

pros: The coffee in the breakroom is surprisingly good.

pros: Quarterly town halls keep us informed.

pros: I have a lot of autonomy in how I do my work.

pros: Good equity package for early employees.

pros: They provide a budget for setting up a home office.

pros: Lots of smart people to learn from.

pros: The product we build actually helps people.

pros: Summer Fridays (half days) are a great perk.

pros: Good severance packages if layoffs happen.

pros: Ability to purchase extra vacation days.
